poem:
Title: Painting of Shadows

In the Turbine's hollow throat,
among a thousand lives afloat,
Gerry espied a mystery mote.
On concrete canvas, light wrote
an enigmatic, sightless quote.
Around them kaleidoscopes of note,
but quietude in this single stroke.
There within art's cathedral spire,
burns a humble, silent fire,
unknown, unlit – the world entire.
